message: Anyway, if you need help just contact me :)
I'm in the process of evaluating CMS apps for an upcoming project and these are on my radar. Hoping there's some collective experience I can tap into while I put together some demo sites...
django-cms and mezzanine are the best. I plan to update my http://pydanny.blogspot.com/2009/11/picking-django-powered-cms.html soonish.

What about these two Django CMS: http://callowayproject.com/ and http://www.merengueproject.org ? Both looks feature rich, but I've not seen any reviews on them yet. Let's hope pydanny include them in his updated blogpost :-)

You can setup a simple example Django Fiber environment in about 15 minutes: https://github.com/ridethepony/django-fiber-example and did you already check out the screencast? http://vimeo.com/ridethepony/django-fiber

(Full disclosure: I'm one of the Django Fiber core developers) I would like to urge you to try out Django Fiber before you make your decision. A lot of people that have jumped in and tried out 'the underdog' (although almost 10.000 PyPI downloads should count for something) are very positive about it.

@dbunskoek Thank you so much! I have to say that what I have seen so far makes me very positive about Fiber. On thing is holding me back: I don't see a clear way of creating content that is not HTML. Ideally, I would like to create functional content (for example a poll) that could be dragged onto a page just like any other piece of content.

@sivictor We're working on that, but it's a hard nut to crack. What we currently do in our own projects is just create a Django view (in your case for the poll), and add a Fiber page to that. This works like a charm (but isn't drag-drop, obviously). And this follows the Django Fiber philosophy of "being a complement to your Django app, and not take it over".
Mezzanine is evolving quickly and has good features out of the box : inline editing , form builder, etc... have a look at the demo
Thanks all, reviewing the sites for these projects brings home the need for a better requirements document from me going in.

One surprise has been Merengue. I usually start at djangopackages, and I've never followed up on this project based on the lack of posted updates, etc. I'm definitely going to give this one a try, though.
you should give django-cms a run also. It's quite mature and very powerful if you want to extend
Haven't seen Fiber before, going to check it out
@pydanny, let me know if you need any help with updating the post. Looks like it is useful to many people.

I'm using FeinCMS on one project, it's worked well for us. I haven't used any of the others yet, though Fiber looked great at EuroDjangoCon. Merengue looks interesting, looks very reminiscent of Plone.
